adjectives.description: inbred (comparative more inbred, superlative most inbred)

examples: We who from daily experience knew Miss Smedley like a book—were we not only too well aware that she had neither accomplishments nor charms—no characteristic, in fact, but an inbred viciousness of temper and disposition?

entries.meaning: (often derogatory) Having an ancestry characterized by inbreeding.
(genetics) Describing a strain produced through successive generations of inbreeding resulting in a population of genetically identical individuals which are homozygous at all genetic loci.

examples: Since you all marry your cousins I bet you're a bunch of inbreds.

entries.meaning: simple past tense and past participle of inbreed
examples: People discovered that the Belgian hare of those days was a very delicate animal and that it was subject to many diseases. It had been inbred so long in order to produce show animals that its vitality was nearly gone.
